news_header: A schoolboy found a historical coin in Espoo, leading to its reporting under the Antiquities Act.
news_original_title: Koululainen löysi 230 vuotta vanhan kuparirahan Espoosta
news_text: On January 24th, a schoolboy discovered an archaeological coin in the Järvenperä population park in Espoo, which dates back to 1795 and was made by Empress Catherine II. The discovery was reported to the National Board of Antiquities as required by the Antiquities Act. The popularity of metal exploration has led to more historical object discoveries. The coin may have been lost by a Russian soldier during the Finnish War. The National Board of Antiquities is documenting the find, which provides insights into Finland's history. The student who found the coin was allowed to keep it.
